revision.text:
In the culture and practice of some [[Christian]] churches - mainly, but not solely, the [[Roman Catholic Church]] - a '''Shrine to the Virgin Mary''' (or '''Marian shrine''') is a [[shrine]] marking an [[Marian apparitions|apparition]] or other [[miracle]] ascribed to the [[Blessed Virgin Mary]], or a site on which is centered a historically strong [[Blessed Virgin Mary|Marian]] devotion. Such locales are often the destination of [[pilgrimages]]
Some of the largest shrines are due to reported [[Marian apparition]]s to young and simple people on remote hilltops that had hardly been heard of prior to the reported apparition. The case of Saint [[Juan Diego]]'s reported vision of [[Our Lady of Guadalupe]] in 1531 is similar to the case of Saint [[Bernadette Soubirous]]'s vision in 1858 of [[Our Lady of Lourdes]]. Both saints reported a miraculous Lady on a hilltop who asked them to request that the local priests build a chapel at the site of the vision. Both visions included a reference to roses and led to large churches being built at the sites. Like [[Our Lady of Guadalupe]] in Mexico, [[Our Lady of Lourdes]] is a major Catholic symbol in France. Both visionaries were eventually declared saints.
The number of pilgrims who visit some of these shrines every year can be significant. E.g. [[Lourdes]] with a population of around 15,000 people, receives about 5,000,000 pilgrims every year and within France only Paris has more hotel rooms than Lourdes. Over 1,000,000 pilgrims visit the Black Madonna statue in the [[Our Lady of Altötting|Chapel of Grace in Altötting]], Germany every year, where for more than 500 years miracles have been attributed to praying to the Virgin Mary at that shrine.
[[File:Maryaltar2.jpg|thumb|right|Side altar to the Blessed Virgin Mary in [[St Mary's Pro-Cathedral]] in Dublin]] [[File:Brdów - kościół i klasztor.jpg|thumb|right|The Sanctuary of Victoriaus Our Lady in [[Brdów]] ([[Poland]])]]
[[File:Ladylebanon.JPG|thumb|right|[[Our Lady of Lebanon]], Harissa, [[Lebanon]]]] [[File:Baclaranchurch.jpg|thumb|right|An image of [[Our Mother of Perpetual Help]] inside the [[National Shrine of Our Mother of Perpetual Help]].]] <!-- Unsourced selection of what one user once considered most significant. Guadalupe, Lourdes, Fátima, Montserrat, Loreto, okay. But then it inevitably gets POV. ==Major shrines== An extensive list of shrines by country is provided in the following sections. Some major shrines considered most significant for their apparitions and miracles are listed in this section:
* [[Black Madonna of Częstochowa]] in [[Częstochowa]], Poland * [[Basilica della Santa Casa]] in [[Loreto]], Italy * [[Basilica of the National Shrine of Our Lady of Aparecida]], Brazil. * [[Our Lady of Fátima]] in [[Fátima, Portugal]] * [[Our Lady of Altötting]], [[Altötting]], Germany * [[Our Lady of Good Success]], [[Madrid, Spain]] * [[Our Lady of La Salette]] in [[La Salette, Isère|La Salette]], France * [[Our Lady of Lebanon]], [[Harissa, Lebanon]] * [[Our Lady of Guadalupe|The Basilica of Guadalupe]] in [[Mexico City]], Mexico * [[Our Lady of Knock|The Basilica of Our Lady, Queen of Ireland]] in [[Knock, County Mayo|Knock]], Ireland * The [[Basilica of Our Lady of the Pillar]], [[Zaragoza]], [[Aragón]], Spain * The [[Sanctuary of Our Lady of Lourdes]] in [[Lourdes]], France * The [[Chapel of Our Lady of the Miraculous Medal]] in Paris, France * [[Korattymuthy]] Shrine in [[Koratty]], [[Kerala]], India * [[Our Lady of Manaoag|National Shrine of Our Lady of the Most Holy Rosary of Manaoag]], [[Manaoag, Pangasinan]] Philippines * [[National Shrine of Our Mother of Perpetual Help]], Philippines * The [[Archdiocese of Manila|Minor Basilica of the Immaculate Conception, Manila]], Philippines * The Archdiocesan Shrine of [[Our Lady of Caysasay]], [[Taal, Batangas]], Philippines * [[Our Lady of Peñafrancia]] in [[Naga City]], [[Camarines Sur]], Philippines * [[Our Lady of Salambao]], [[Obando, Bulacan]], Philippines * [[Basilica of Our Lady of Good Health]] in India. * [[Our Lady of Meritxell]], Andorra * [[Our Lady of San Juan de los Lagos]], [[Jalisco]], Mexico * [[Our Lady of Montserrat]], [[Catalonia]], Spain * Shrine of the [[Virgin of Ocotlán]], [[Ocotlán, Tlaxcala]], Mexico * [[Our Lady of the Gate of Dawn]], [[Vilnius]], [[Lithuania]] * [[Our Lady of the Rosary of Chiquinquirá]], [[Colombia]] * Basilica of [[Our Lady of La Vang]], [[La Vang]], [[Vietnam]] * The Basilica of the Most Holy Theotokos of [[Zarvanytsia]], Ukraine * [[Our Lady of Walsingham]], [[Norfolk]], England. * Our Lady of Alcobaça, [[Alcobaça (Portugal)|Alcobaça]], Portugal. * Our Lady of Altagracia, [[Higuey]], [[Dominican Republic]]. * [[San Francisco de Cuapa]],Cuapa,Nicaragua For the [[Greek Orthodox Church|Greek Orthodox]] the major Marian Shrine is the Church of [[Our Lady of Tinos]], at [[Tinos]] island in Greece which constitutes the most important Christian pilgrimage in the [[Aegean Sea|Aegean]]. -->

==Germany== * Shrine of St. Mary, in [[Aachen Cathedral]]. This church, frequently referred to as the "Imperial Cathedral" (in German: Kaiserdom), is a Roman Catholic church in Aachen, Germany. * [[Our Lady of Altötting|Chapel of Grace, in Altötting]], Bavaria. The first miracles attributed to praying to the Virgin Mother at this shrine took place in 1489. * Chapel of Grace in [[Kevelaer]], North Rhine-Westphalia, place of an "Image of Grace" ("Gnadenbild") of St. Mary since the [[Thirty Years' War]].
==Greece== * [[Our Lady of Tinos]], [[Tinos]] Island, Greece's patron saint. * Autonomous Monastic State of the Holy Mountain, [[Mount Athos]], Greece,the garden of the Mother of God being out of bounds to all other women.
==Gibraltar== * [[Europa Point#Shrine of Our Lady of Europe|Our Lady of Europe]] at Europa Point, the southernmost point in Western Europe. A shrine to Mary has existed on the site since 1462. [http://www.gibraltar.gov.gi/tourism/lady_of_europe.htm]
==Holy Land== * The [[Basilica of the Annunciation]], in [[Nazareth]]. * The Church of the Dormition of Our Lady on [[Mount Zion]], in [[Jerusalem]]. * The Church of the Tomb of the Virgin Mary in the garden of [[Gethsemane]], in Jerusalem * The Milk Grotto Church of Virgin Mary in [[Bethlehem]]

==Turkey== * [[House of the Virgin Mary]] in [[Ephesus]], Turkey, believed to be the place where Mary was taken to by [[John the Apostle|St. John]] and lived until the Assumption * [[Church of Mary]] in [[Ephesus]], Turkey, in which the [[First Council of Ephesus|Council of Ephesus]] (the Third Ecumenical Council) was held in 431 * [[Life-giving Spring]] in [[Istanbul]], a famous spring associated with the healing powers of the Theotokos, the feast of which is celebrated on the Friday after Easter.

==United Kingdom== *Ladyewell Shrine; St Mary's at Fernyhalgh and Ladyewell - The Shrine of Our Lady and the Martyrs.http://www.ladyewellshrine.co.uk/home/home.htm Preston,Near Fulwood,Lancashire,England * [[Our Lady of Ipswich]] in [[Ipswich]], England * Anglican shrine and Roman Catholic "national shrine" of [[Our Lady of Walsingham]] in [[Walsingham]], England<ref>[http://www.walsingham.org.uk/ View of the two Walsingham shrines] on their joint website.</ref> * [[Church of Our Lady of Egmanton|Shrine of Our Lady of Egmanton]] in [[Egmanton]], [[Nottinghamshire]], England * [[Our Lady of Cardigan|Our Lady of the Taper]] in [[Cardigan, Ceredigion|Cardigan]], [[Wales]] * Shrine of Our Lady of [[Caversham, Berkshire|Caversham]], near [[Reading, Berkshire|Reading]] in [[Berkshire]] * [[Shrine of Our Lady, Bradstowe]] * Shrine of Our Lady in [[Penrhys#The Shrine of "Our Lady"|Penrhys]], Wales * [[Our Lady of Doncaster]] in [[Doncaster]], England * [[Our Lady of Westminster]] in [[Westminster Cathedral]], London * Anglican Church and Shrine of St Mary's, [[Willesden]], London NW10<ref>[http://www.stmarywillesden.org.uk/Building5.html Inside view of the Anglican shrine of St Mary's], 18 Willesden Lane, London NW10.</ref> * Roman Catholic Church and Shrine of Our Lady of Willesden, [[Willesden]], London NW10<ref>[http://www.flickr.com/photos/simon_p_white/2998299499/ Inside view of the Roman Catholic shrine of Our Lady of Willesden], a side chapel accessible from within the church of Our Lady of Willesden in Nicoll Road, London NW10.</ref> * Church and Shrine of Our Lady of the Assumption and St Gregory (also known as "Church of the Assumption" and "Warwick Street Church"), London W1<ref>[http://www.flickr.com/photos/simon_p_white/1028246100/ Warwick Street Church, London W1], displaying a sign "Church of the Assumption"; [http://www.flickr.com/photos/canon_reginald_c_fuller/5721372609/in/set-72157626599439809 Lady Chapel]; [http://www.flickr.com/photos/canon_reginald_c_fuller/5721500501/in/set-72157626724343742 Grant of Indulgence] (Summary of the Decree of Pope Pius IX, promulgated 15 May 1877, remaining in force in perpetuity).</ref>
